js
Class Function.Call<T>

java.lang.Object
  js.Function.Call<T>
Enclosing class:
Function<T>
protected static final class Function.Call<T>
extends java.lang.Object

An opaque class used inside function definition resembling JavaScript callee and caller.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
JavaScript:
Opaque types can be resolved but no class objects for them can be generated into the target codes. Re-compilers must exit with error on the operations of accessing that kind of class objects.

Field Summary
 Function.Arguments arguments
          The arguments field of the current callee or caller instance.
 
Method Summary
 T apply(java.lang.Object thisobj)
          Invokes the current function instance as a method of a specified scope object.
 T apply(java.lang.Object thisobj, java.lang.Object args)
          Invokes the current function instance as a method of a specified scope object, passing the specified array of arguments.
 T call(java.lang.Object thisobj)
          Invokes the current function instance as a method of a specified scope object.
 T call(java.lang.Object thisobj, java.lang.Object arg)
          Invokes the current function instance as a method of a specified scope object, passing the specified argument.
 T call(java.lang.Object thisobj, Vars<?> args)
          Invokes the current function instance as a method of a specified scope object, passing the specified arguments.
 T invoke()
          Invokes the current function instance.
 T invoke(java.lang.Object arg)
          Invokes the current function instance, passing the specified argument.
 T invoke(Vars<?> args)
          Invokes the current function instance, passing the specified arguments.
 java.lang.String toString()
          Returns the string representing the current function instance.
 Function<T> var()
          Returns the function instance.

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
 

Field Detail

arguments

public final Function.Arguments arguments

The arguments field of the current callee or caller instance.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the access of this instance field directly into a JavaScript expression of the field access to its current instance without changing the field name.
Method Detail

var

public final Function<T> var()

Returns the function instance.

Returns:
The function instance.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must ignore the instance invocation of this method, that is, replacing it with its current function instance.

invoke

public final T invoke()

Invokes the current function instance.

Returns:
The return value of the invocation.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method into the JavaScript expression: 
f()
where f is the current instance of the invocation.

invoke

public final T invoke(java.lang.Object arg)

Invokes the current function instance, passing the specified argument.

Parameters:
arg - The argument value.
Returns:
The return value of the invocation.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method into the JavaScript expression: 
f(arg)
where f is the current instance of the invocation.

invoke

public final T invoke(Vars<?> args)

Invokes the current function instance, passing the specified arguments.

Parameters:
args - The list of arguments.
Returns:
The return value of the invocation.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method into the JavaScript expression: 
f(args)
where f is the current instance of this invocation and args must be expanded into comma-separated arguments.

call

public final T call(java.lang.Object thisobj)

Invokes the current function instance as a method of a specified scope object.

Parameters:
thisobj - The scope object.
Returns:
The return value of the invocation.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - JavaScript throws a TypeError if this method is invoked with a scope object that is not a function. See Js.err(Object) and JsTypeError for JS Simulation.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

apply

public final T apply(java.lang.Object thisobj,
                     java.lang.Object args)

Invokes the current function instance as a method of a specified scope object, passing the specified array of arguments.

Parameters:
thisobj - The scope object.
args - The array of arguments.
Returns:
The return value of the invocation.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - JavaScript throws a TypeError if this method is invoked with a scope object that is not a function or if this method is invoked with an argument that is not an array or Function.Arguments object. See Js.err(Object) and JsTypeError for JS Simulation.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.
